author: Alex Ungerman ET Online
title: Maroon 5, possibly Adele in talks to perform at Super Bowl
text:
Super Bowl 50 may just have gotten epic ...
Maroon 5 is rumored to be in talks to be featured during the halftime show of the NFL championship game in Santa Clara, California on Feb. 7, 2016 and airing on CBS. What's more, a halftime show source tells ET that Adele is also a big possibility!
" Maroon 5 is just a rumor right now," the source reveals. "They have NOT been booked yet. It wouldn't be a surprise if they perform as part of the show, but they are not the headliner. There are a few performers this year."
More: Adele reveals cover and release date for new "25" album With Adele's new album, "25," dropping in November , the timing is right for a big game show.
Play Video CBSN Adam Levine sugar-bombed after Jimmy Kimmel show Maroon 5 lead singer Adam Levine was covered in sugar on his way out of a performance at "Jimmy Kimmel Live." CBSN's Vladimir Duthiers and Meg Ol...
"Bruno [Mars] was obsessed with having Adele join him two years ago but she wouldn't do it," says the source. "I'm not sure if he has spoken to her yet, but it would make sense since she has an album coming out."
The reason this is a big deal is that ET learned in September that Mars has been asked back to perform for the Super Bowl 50 halftime show, as part of a larger group of performers.
Watch: Bruno Mars to perform at Super Bowl 50 halftime show His previous Super Bowl halftime performance is the second most-watched show ever, drawing 115 million viewers, following only Katy Perry's show in 2015.
Play Video Entertainment Maroon 5 fan rushes stage during concert An over-enthusiastic fan disrupted a Maroon 5 concert in Southern California on Monday night. She rushed the stage, hoping to get a hug from lead...
Adele's camp had no comment on the Super Bowl rumors, but the singer is officially in full album promotion mode.
More: The top 7 Super Bowl halftime moments In a letter posted to Facebook by the 27-year-old singer, Adele said the new record will be more introspective and less about relationships than her massively successful "23" album.
"My last record was a break-up record and if I had to label this one, I would call it a make-up record," she wrote. "I'm making up with myself. Making up for lost time. Making up for everything I ever did and never did. But I haven't got time to hold on to the crumbs of my past like I used to. What's done is done."
Photos: Bruno Mars standing next to tall people will make your day We don't know though ... can the Super Bowl HANDLE an Adele halftime show? Let us know what you think!
